stories.text:
I'm less interested in purely political and societal challenges and solutions. Not that they are not important and or worth discussing. But I feel like I'm not up to date with what is possible or might be possible in the somewhat near future to solve one of the most pressing issues we are facing.

Some pointers:

- energy storage, batteries

- types of power plants

- refinements and improvements of existing solutions

- not yet exploited solutions

- new methods for recycling or repurposing waste
stories.title: Ask HN: What are the most promising technical solutions to energy/climate change
Aggressive Measures, Rising Inequalities and Mass Formation During Covid-19

stories.text:
And if so, why? Won't the updated vaccines also be safe (though perhaps not as effective as desired)?

What if there isn't enough time for testing?
stories.title: Ask HN: Do mRNA vaccines need to be tested when updated to handle variants?
